reviewText: This was a great show from beginning to end. It is also a bit historical these days but it has never lost its edge and proves you can do a good program in a half hour as one can in an hour. It also introduced us to some great characters, Pete Malloy, Jim Reed, Ed Wells, Sgt. Mc Donald. They were every cop and they were involved in all kinds of situations from the silly to the intense. While it may seem a bit dated in some ways, the action isn't. It is still as fresh as it was when it was first aired. It's nice to look back and see that some things don't have to change to still be good.

reviewText: Thank you Shout Factory for continuing to release the Adam-12 franchise!  The show just keeps getting better by the season and volume 5 is no exception.  Buy it with no regrets.By the way, Jack Webb had a knack for advertising new projects.  I'm quite certain that one of your favorite episodes will be the one where Reed and Malloy end up taking a young boy to Rampart General Hospital where you will meet the main cast of Emergency!  (Julie, Robert, Bobby, Kevin, and Randy!)  It's truly a Jack Webb "overload." - Brilliant!Dragnet 1968: Season Two

reviewText: I have enjoyed the first 4 seasons and wait with great anticipation for season 5 to hit the market.The stories are taken from real life cases in L.A. If you like Dragnet you will feel the same about this show. Not only was it a great series but the quality of the first 4 seasons of Adam 12 have been outstanding, no reason to think otherwise with this next season. And to top it off it comes in at a very attractive and affordable price at less then $25.00...Great deal, great show and great quality, hard to top that.

Any fan of the series definately wants Season Five.

reviewText: Okay, self-admitted major Adam-12 nut here. I liked it when it was new, and I think high production values and realistic representation of the LAPD have left us with a show that's aged so well that I don't anything since has ever come close (other Jack Webb productions excluded, of course). There's just enough of a human element to make the the characters real yet no so much that it sidetracks the fast-paced action. It's hard to believe how much ground these shows cover in a single episode, literally and figuratively.My only beef, and reason I had to give this a 4 instead of a 5 is because the first of the four DVDs is saddled with a promo for three really sad 1980s shows that is one of the longest and most annoying I've ever seen on any TV show or movie I've ever purchased. It just goes on and on and on. It's more of an infomercial than a commercial or promo really. So when you pop in disk one, you'll have plenty of time to go make a sandwich, take a shower, or check your email before you can start watching the shows. Thankfully this only applies the first DVD in the set.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A realistic police drama following the lives of two officers of the LAPD, veteran Los Angeles police Officer Pete Malloy(Martin Milner) and his rookie partner, Los Angeles police Officer Jim Reed(Kent McCord). Done in a spare, almost "docudrama" style, each episode covered a variety of incidents that the patrolmen encountered during a shift, from the tragic to the trivial kind of like it's associated police drama DRAGNET did with Detective Sgt. Joe Friday(Jack Webb)and Det. Bill Gannon(Harry Morgan).You can also see these episodes of ADAM-12 complete & uncut without all those deleted scenes you get watching ADAM-12 and DRAGNET in reruns on ME-TV, Antenna TV, TV Land, and Nickelodeon too since these DVD's don't allot more time for added commercial disruptions.
